intro: Phymatidium seehaweri, commonly known as the Hawaiian fernbush, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes sedges and buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive, palmate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
